alert.note: Alert for Crawford; Franklin; Washington (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 4:04PM CDT until May 19 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northeastern Crawford County in east central Missouri... Northwestern Washington County in east central Missouri... Franklin County in east central Missouri... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 403 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Sullivan to 9 miles southeast of Anthonies Mill, moving northeast at 60 mph. This storm is associated with a bowing line, in addition to other individual cells running ahead of the main line. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Richwoods around 415 PM CDT. St. Clair and Parkway around 420 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Lonedell, Villa Ridge, Pacific and Gray Summit. This includes Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 218 and 257. This also includes Robertsville State Park and Meramec State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Missouri. Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Missouri.
